Max generations (0 = all combinations -: Max generations (0 = all combinations - the batch count value is ignored)
Choose a number of terms from a list, in: Choose a number of terms from a list, in this case we choose two artists:
If $$ is not provided, then 1$$ is assum: If $$ is not provided, then 1$$ is assumed.
If the chosen number of terms is greater: If the chosen number of terms is greater than the available terms, then some terms will be duplicated, otherwise chosen terms will be unique. This is useful in the case of wildcards, e.g.
In this case, a random number of artists: In this case, a random number of artists between 1 and 3 is chosen.
In this case, artist1 will be chosen twi: In this case, artist1 will be chosen twice as often as artist2.
Wildcards can be used and the joiner can: Wildcards can be used and the joiner can also be specified:
Here, a random number between 1 and 3 wo: Here, a random number between 1 and 3 words from adjective.txt will be chosen and joined together with the word 'and' instead of the default comma.
Find and manage wildcards in the Wildcar: Find and manage wildcards in the Wildcards Manager tab.
Jinja2 templates is an experimental feat: Jinja2 templates is an experimental feature for advanced template generation. It is not recommended for general use unless you are comfortable with writing scripts.
This will randomly choose one of the thr: This will randomly choose one of the three colors.
This will produce three prompts, one for: This will produce three prompts, one for each color. The prompt tag is used to mark the text that will be used as the prompt. If no prompt tag is present then only one prompt is assumed
This will produce one prompt for each co: This will produce one prompt for each colour in the wildcard.txt file.
This will produce the following prompts:: This will produce the following prompts:
Jinja2 templates are based on the Jinja2: Jinja2 templates are based on the Jinja2 template engine. For more information see the
If you are using these templates, please: If you are using these templates, please let me know if they are useful.
Some settings have been moved to the set: Some settings have been moved to the settings tab. Find them in the Dynamic Prompts section.
1. Create your wildcard library by copyi: 1. Create your wildcard library by copying a collection using the dropdown below.
2. Click on any of the files that appear: 2. Click on any of the files that appear in the tree to edit them.
3. Use the wildcard in your script by ty: 3. Use the wildcard in your script by typing the name of the file or copying the text from the Wildcards file text box
Ignore whitespace in prompts: All newlin: Ignore whitespace in prompts: All newlines, tabs, and multiple spaces are replaced by a single space
Save template to metadata: Write prompt: Save template to metadata: Write prompt template into the PNG metadata
Write prompts to file: Create a new .txt: Write prompts to file: Create a new .txt file for every batch containing the prompt template as well as the generated prompts.
String to use as left bracket for parser: String to use as left bracket for parser variants, .e.g {variant1|variant2|variant3}
String to use as right bracket for parse: String to use as right bracket for parser variants, .e.g {variant1|variant2|variant3}
String to use as wrap for parser wildcar: String to use as wrap for parser wildcard, .e.g __wildcard__
Limit Jinja prompts: Limit the number of: Limit Jinja prompts: Limit the number of prompts to batch_count * batch_size. The default is to generate batch_count * barch_size * number of prompts generated by Jinja
Disable dynamic prompts by unchecking th: Disable dynamic prompts by unchecking this box.
Instead of generating random prompts fro:
Instead of generating random prompts from a template, combinatorial generation produces every possible prompt from the given string.
The prompt 'I {love|hate} {New York|Chicago} in {June|July|August}' will produce 12 variants in total.

The value of the 'Seed' field is only used for the first image. To change this, look for 'Fixed seed' in the 'Advanced options' section.
Limit the maximum number of prompts gene: Limit the maximum number of prompts generated. 0 (default) will generate all images. Useful to prevent an unexpected combinatorial explosion.
Re-run your combinatorial batch this man: Re-run your combinatorial batch this many times with a different seed each time.
Magic Prompt adds interesting modifiers:
Magic Prompt adds interesting modifiers to your prompt for a little bit of extra spice.
The first time you use it, the MagicPrompt model is downloaded so be patient.
If you're running low on VRAM, you might get a CUDA error.
Controls the maximum length in tokens of: Controls the maximum length in tokens of the generated prompt.
Adjusts the generated prompt. You will n: Adjusts the generated prompt. You will need to experiment with this setting.
Regular expression pattern for blocking: Regular expression pattern for blocking terms out of the generated prompt. Applied case-insensitively. For instance, to block both "purple" and "interdimensional", you could use the pattern "purple|interdimensional".
The number of prompts to generate per ba: The number of prompts to generate per batch. Increasing this can speed up prompt generation at the expense of slightly increased VRAM usage.
Uses the lexica.art API to create random:
Uses the lexica.art API to create random prompts.
The prompt in the main prompt box is used as a search string.
Leaving the prompt box blank returns a list of completely randomly chosen prompts.
Try it out, it can be quite fun.
Randomly selects a keyword from the prom: Randomly selects a keyword from the prompt and adds emphasis to it. Try this with Fixed Seed enabled.
Don't use prompt magic on negative promp: Don't use prompt magic on negative prompts.
Jinja2 templates are an expressive alter: Jinja2 templates are an expressive alternative to the standard syntax. See the Help section below for instructions.
Check this if you want to generate rando: Check this if you want to generate random prompts, even if your seed is fixed
Select this if you want to use the same:
Select this if you want to use the same seed for every generated image.
This is useful if you want to test prompt variations while using the same seed.
If there are no wildcards then all the images will be identical.
Write the prompt template into the image: Write the prompt template into the image metadata
Be sure to check the 'Write prompts to f: Be sure to check the 'Write prompts to file' checkbox if you don't want to lose the generated prompts. Note, one image is still generated.
The generated file is a slugified versio:
The generated file is a slugified version of the prompt and can be found in the same directory as the generated images.
E.g. in ./outputs/txt2img-images/.
Complete documentation is available at h: Complete documentation is available at https://github.com/adieyal/sd-dynamic-prompts. Please report any issues on GitHub.
Automatically update your prompt with in: Automatically update your prompt with interesting modifiers. (Runs slowly the first time)
Generate random prompts from lexica.art: Generate random prompts from lexica.art (your prompt is used as a search query).
Use the same seed for all prompts in thi: Use the same seed for all prompts in this batch
Write all generated prompts to a file: Write all generated prompts to a file
If this is set, then random prompts are: If this is set, then random prompts are generated, even if the seed is the same.
Disable image generation. Useful if you: Disable image generation. Useful if you only want to generate text prompts. (1 image will still be generated to keep Auto1111 happy.).
Add emphasis to a randomly selected keyw: Add emphasis to a randomly selected keyword in the prompt.
Note: Each model will download between 3: Note: Each model will download between 300mb and 1.4gb of data on first use.
